page.title: 01COTHERSTONE VILLAGE & AREA
page.content: Cotherstone is situated in the Pennines of NE England, on the south bank of the river Tees, in County Durham. Teesdale is an area of great beauty and attracts many tourists. The surrounding countryside is given over to stock rearing farms and grassland abounds, with open moors on the higher reaches. The confluence of the rivers Balder and Tees is at Cotherstone and is a local beauty spot (Photo A). The village is typical of this area; some 60 houses built from local sandstone and arranged around two village greens (Photo B). There is a shop, post office, butcher's shop, petrol filling station, 2 public houses, primary school, 3 churches, village hall and one factory. Transport is mainly by private car but there is a limited bus service. Population of area is approx 500.
